intro: Psacalium amplum, commonly known as the broadleaf psacalium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
